translated: Description: This manuscript is called Kula-sāra. But is in fact a collection of fragments of three Kaula tracts. The first is Kaula-sāra-saṃgraha which, according to the colophons, is a part of the Soma-bhuja-valī. It begins with chapter 1 and extends up to chapter 10. It is followed by the Kula-ācāra-nirṇaya which extends from chapter 10 to chapter 15. The third fragment is chapter 18 of a work belonging to the Śrīvidyā lineage of Subhagānanda-nātha. It deals with the funeral rites of a Kaula. The texts of which these are fragments are in the form of a tantra, outlining the principles of Kaula ritual and practice. They are typical Kaula works belonging to the later period, that is, after the century
